item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

Like if I had something like this,

[code]int alchvaluez = (int) Math.floor(GetItemValue(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]) + GetItemValue(freeSlots()));

but instead of the freeslots, (which did nothing) I want a code that gets all items in my inventory (lets say I have a whip, dfs, etc.) and it adds all them together.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

Using the following code:

if (alchvaluez < 1000000) { hint = 1; } if (alchvaluez < 5000000 && alchvaluez> 1000001){ hint = 2; } if (alchvaluez < 10000000 && alchvaluez > 5000001){ hint = 3; } if (alchvaluez < 20000000 && alchvaluez > 10000001){ hint = 4; } if (alchvaluez > 25000000){ hint = 5; }

My original problem was “If I alch something worth over 25m (Last one), it shows hint 5, however anything under that it shows hint 4. How could I fix?”

Now it always shows hint 1 for anything under 25m.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

I have something get the total of an item the person is alching, if it is worth less than 5000000 but worth more 1000001 it shows a hint above their head, however it does not work. Anyone see any problems in the whole code?

if (alchvaluez < 1000000) { hint = 1; } if (alchvaluez < 5000000 || > alchvaluez 1000001){ hint = 2; } if (alchvaluez < 10000000 || alchvaluez > 5000001){ hint = 3; } if (alchvaluez < 20000000 || alchvaluez > 10000001){ hint = 4; } if (alchvaluez >= 25000000){ hint = 5; }
EDIT:
A more detailed explanation that explains what happens: If I alch something worth over 25m (Last one), it shows hint 5, however anything under that it shows hint 4. How could I fix?

Read full topic
